ground_truth: Voldemort glances at the snake, and they dis-apparate. Harry continues to shiver as disheveled and dirty, Hermione and Ron approach him. Hermione turns anxiously to Ron, and he crouches down beside Harry. Harry looks worried as Hermione squats down. Harry closes his eyes and takes a deep breath while his jaw remains tense, breathing through his mouth. Nagini is curled up in a boat house where Lucius Malfoy is present with Voldemort, who examines the skin on his own forearm. When Harry opens his eyes, the others stare at him anxiously as the Death Eaters sweep over the school. A student flies in on a broomstick as a giant swings a scythe, and the others fight on the stairs. Hermione runs through a door, narrowly avoiding a bolt, as Harry beats on a door and shoots a Death Eater. A giant with two-pronged weapons spots the trio, and they run, hiding inside a huge bell lying on its side as the giant's weapon strikes it. Colossal spiders appear scrambling over the rubble, causing them to retreat. Hermione runs between the giants, and they fend off attacks with their wands to reach a quieter area. They stop when they spot a Death Eater leaning over a girl's body, as a werewolf glances up. Hermione casts a spell, knocking Fenrir Greyback through a window. They run through a closed-end walkway with the giants keeping pace, smashing the walls. Racing to the front of the school, they see Dementors flying towards them, when suddenly a shimmering barrier is thrown by Aberforth Dumbledore, holding a wand in his outstretched hand. As Aberforth and his allies turn back to fight, the trio sprints away, running onto a raised walkway and down steps towards the boat house lights where Snape is with Voldemort. Voldemort stares at him as Snape perfects a smile, circling him with his eyes fixed on Voldemort. With a slicing move with the Elder Wand, Snape falls against a glass paneled wall with Harry on the other side. Mouth agape, the snake lunges repeatedly at Snape, thumping him against the lead panned glass, which shakes but doesn't give way, as Harry and the others grab helplessly outside. Snape's bloody hand slides down a window and falls limply to the floor as Harry and the others enter the boat house to find Snape still alive. His lower jaw trembles as Harry moves towards him, kneels down, and leans forward to staunch a wound on Snape's neck. The dying Snape turns his head to look at Harry, who gazes deeply into his eyes as a tear rolls down Snape's cheek, while Hermione rummages in her bag and pulls out a small phial.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation

Ron is turned to anxiously by Hermione, and Harry is crouched beside by him. Hermione is looked at worriedly by Harry as she squats down. Harry's eyes are closed by him, and a deep breath is taken while his jaw remains tense, breathing through his mouth. Nagini has curled up in a boat house where Lucius Malfoy is present with Voldemort, who examines the skin on his own forearm. When Harry opens his eyes, he is stared at anxiously by the others as the Death Eaters sweep over the school. A broomstick is flown in on by a student as a giant swings a scythe, and fighting on the stairs is continued by the others. A door is run through by Hermione, narrowly avoiding a bolt, as a door is beaten on by Harry and a Death Eater is shot. The trio is spotted by a giant with two-pronged weapons, and running is done by them, hiding inside a huge bell lying on its side as the giant's weapon is struck against it. Colossal spiders are appeared by, scrambling over the rubble, causing a retreat. The giants are run between by Hermione, and attacks are fended off with their wands by them to reach a quieter area. They stop when a Death Eater is spotted leaning over a girl's body, as a werewolf glances up. A spell is cast by Hermione, knocking Fenrir Greyback through a window. Through a closed-end walkway they run, with the giants keeping pace, smashing the walls. Racing to the front of the school, Dementors are seen flying towards them, when suddenly Aberforth Dumbledore throws a shimmering barrier, holding a wand in his outstretched hand. As Aberforth and his allies turn back to fight, a sprint away is made by the trio, running onto a raised walkway and down steps towards the boat house lights where Snape is with Voldemort. Snape is stared at by Voldemort as a smile is perfected by Snape, circling him with his eyes fixed on Voldemort. With a slicing move with the Elder Wand, Snape is caused to fall against a glass-paneled wall with Harry on the other side. With his mouth agape, Snape is lunged at repeatedly by the snake, thumping him against the lead-paned glass, which shakes but doesn't give way, as Harry and the others grab helplessly outside. A bloody hand belonging to Snape slides down a window and falls limply to the floor as the boat house is entered by Harry and the others to find Snape still alive. His lower jaw is trembling as Snape moves towards Harry, who kneels down and leans forward to staunch a wound on Snape's neck. The dying Snape's head is turned to look at Harry, who gazes deeply into his eyes as a tear is rolled down Snape's cheek, while Hermione rummages in her bag and pulls out a small phial.

Harry closes his eyes, breathing through his mouth, while Nagini is curled in a boathouse with Lucius Malfoy and Voldemort, who examines his forearm. When Harry opens his eyes, the others stare anxiously as Death Eaters sweep over the school. A student flies in on a broomstick as a giant swings a scythe, and others fight on the stairs. Hermione narrowly avoids a bolt, as Harry beats on a door and shoots a Death Eater. A giant spots them, and they hide inside a huge bell as the giant's weapon strikes it. Colossal spiders appear, causing them to retreat. Hermione runs between giants, fending off attacks with wands to reach a quieter area. They stop, spotting a Death Eater over a girl's body, as a werewolf glances up. Hermione knocks Fenrir Greyback through a window. They run through a walkway with giants smashing walls. Racing to the front, they see Dementors when Aberforth Dumbledore throws a shimmering barrier. As Aberforth and allies fight, the trio sprints to the boathouse where Snape is with Voldemort. Voldemort stares as Snape perfects a smile, circling him. With a slicing move, Snape falls against a glass wall with Harry on the other side. The snake lunges at Snape, thumping him against the glass, as Harry and others helplessly watch. Snape's bloody hand slides down a window as Harry and others enter to find Snape alive. His jaw trembles as Harry kneels to staunch a wound on Snape's neck. Dying, Snape looks at Harry, who gazes into his eyes as a tear rolls down Snape's cheek, while Hermione pulls out a small phial.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Voldemort glances at the snake and dis-apparates. Harry shivers as disheveled Hermione and Ron approach. Hermione anxiously turns to Ron, who crouches beside Harry. Harry closes his eyes, breathing through his mouth. Nagini is in a boathouse with Lucius Malfoy and Voldemort, who examines his forearm. Harry opens his eyes as Death Eaters sweep over the school. A student flies in as a giant swings a scythe, and others fight on the stairs. Hermione narrowly avoids a bolt, and Harry shoots a Death Eater. A giant spots them, and they hide inside a bell as its weapon strikes. Spiders appear, forcing them to retreat. Hermione runs between giants, fending off attacks to reach a quieter area. They spot a Death Eater over a girl's body, and Hermione knocks Fenrir Greyback through a window. They run as giants smash walls. At the school's front, Dementors approach, but Aberforth Dumbledore creates a barrier. As Aberforth fights, the trio runs to the boathouse where Snape is with Voldemort. Voldemort stares as Snape smiles, circling him. With a slicing move, Snape falls against a glass wall. The snake lunges at Snape, thumping him against the glass as Harry and others watch helplessly. Snape's bloody hand slides down as Harry enters the boathouse, kneels, and staunches Snape's neck wound. Dying, Snape looks at Harry, who gazes into his eyes as a tear rolls down Snape's cheek, while Hermione retrieves a phial.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Voldemort casts a quick glance at the snake, and together, they dis-apparate, vanishing from sight. Meanwhile, Harry continues to shiver uncontrollably as Hermione and Ron, looking disheveled and covered in dirt, approach him with concern. Hermione, filled with anxiety, turns her worried gaze to Ron, who promptly crouches down beside Harry to offer support. Harry, appearing deeply troubled, watches as Hermione squats down next to him. With his jaw remaining tense, Harry closes his eyes and takes a deep, steadying breath, inhaling through his mouth. Elsewhere, Nagini is curled up in a boat house, where Lucius Malfoy stands alongside Voldemort, who is intently examining the skin on his own forearm. When Harry finally opens his eyes, he finds the others staring at him with anxious expressions as the Death Eaters sweep ominously over the school. A student flies in on a broomstick, while a giant menacingly swings a scythe, and others engage in fierce combat on the stairs. Hermione dashes through a door, narrowly avoiding a deadly bolt, as Harry pounds on a door and successfully shoots a Death Eater. A giant, wielding two-pronged weapons, spots the trio, prompting them to flee and hide inside a massive bell lying on its side, just as the giant's weapon strikes it with a loud clang. Colossal spiders suddenly appear, scrambling over the rubble, forcing them to retreat hastily. Hermione bravely runs between the giants, and they fend off relentless attacks with their wands, striving to reach a quieter area. They come to a halt when they spot a Death Eater leaning ominously over a girl's body, while a werewolf glances up with a menacing look. Hermione quickly casts a spell, sending Fenrir Greyback hurtling through a window. They sprint through a closed-end walkway, with the giants keeping pace, smashing the walls with their immense strength. Racing towards the front of the school, they see Dementors ominously flying towards them, when suddenly, a shimmering barrier is conjured by Aberforth Dumbledore, who stands with his wand outstretched in his hand. As Aberforth and his allies turn back to engage in the fight, the trio sprints away, running onto a raised walkway and down the steps towards the boat house lights, where Snape is with Voldemort. Voldemort fixes his gaze on Snape, who perfects a smile, circling him with his eyes locked on Voldemort. With a swift slicing move using the Elder Wand, Snape is sent crashing against a glass-paneled wall, with Harry on the other side. Mouth agape, the snake lunges repeatedly at Snape, thumping him against the lead-paned glass, which shakes but stubbornly refuses to give way, as Harry and the others watch helplessly from outside. Snape's bloody hand slides down a window, falling limply to the floor as Harry and the others enter the boat house to find Snape still clinging to life. His lower jaw trembles as Harry moves towards him, kneels down, and leans forward to staunch a wound on Snape's neck. The dying Snape turns his head to look at Harry, who gazes deeply into his eyes as a tear rolls down Snape's cheek, while Hermione rummages frantically in her bag and pulls out a small phial.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Voldemort swiftly glances at the snake, and in a synchronized movement, they disapparate, vanishing entirely from sight as if they were never there. Meanwhile, Harry finds himself shivering uncontrollably, unable to stop, as his friends Hermione and Ron, who appear disheveled and are covered in dirt, approach him with looks of heartfelt concern written all over their faces. Hermione, filled with anxiety and worry, turns her troubled gaze toward Ron. He promptly crouches down beside Harry to offer him some much-needed support. Harry, appearing deeply troubled and conflicted, watches as Hermione also squats down next to him, unable to hide her concern. With his jaw remaining tense, Harry closes his eyes, taking a deep, steadying breath as he inhales through his mouth, trying to calm himself. Elsewhere, Nagini is curled up comfortably in a boat house, where Lucius Malfoy stands alongside Voldemort. Voldemort, with intent focus, examines the skin on his own forearm. When Harry finally opens his eyes again, he finds the others staring back at him with anxious expressions as the Death Eaters sweep ominously over the school, casting a shadow of dread. A student flies in swiftly on a broomstick, while a giant menacingly swings a scythe, and others engage in fierce combat on the stairs. Hermione dashes through a door, narrowly avoiding a deadly bolt, while Harry pounds on a door and successfully shoots a Death Eater. A giant, brandishing two-pronged weapons, spots the trio, forcing them to flee and find safety inside a massive bell lying on its side, just as the giant's weapon strikes it with a loud, reverberating clang. Suddenly, colossal spiders appear, scrambling over the rubble, forcing them to retreat hastily. Hermione bravely runs between the giants, and they fend off relentless attacks with their wands, striving with all their might to reach a quieter, safer area. They come to an abrupt halt when they spot a Death Eater leaning ominously over a girl's body, while a menacing werewolf glances up with a threatening look. Hermione quickly casts a spell, sending Fenrir Greyback hurtling through a nearby window. They sprint through a closed-end walkway as the giants keep pace, smashing the walls with their immense, overpowering strength. Racing desperately towards the front of the school, they see Dementors ominously flying towards them, when suddenly, a shimmering protective barrier is conjured by Aberforth Dumbledore, who stands with his wand outstretched in his hand. As Aberforth and his allies turn back to re-engage in the chaotic fight, the trio sprints away, running quickly onto a raised walkway and then down the steps towards the boat house lights, where Snape is with Voldemort. Voldemort fixes his intense gaze on Snape, who maintains a perfect smile, circling him with his eyes locked on Voldemort. With a swift slicing move using the Elder Wand, Snape is sent crashing violently against a glass-paneled wall, with Harry watching from the other side. Mouth agape, the snake lunges repeatedly at Snape, thumping him against the lead-paned glass, which shakes but stubbornly refuses to give way, as Harry and the others watch helplessly from outside. Snape's bloody hand slides slowly down a window, ultimately falling limply to the floor as Harry and the others enter the boat house to find Snape still fighting to cling to life. His lower jaw trembles as Harry moves toward him, kneels down, and leans forward to attempt to staunch a wound on Snape's neck. The dying Snape turns his head to look at Harry, who gazes deeply into his eyes as a single tear rolls down Snape's cheek, while Hermione rummages frantically in her bag and pulls out a small phial.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Voldemort casts a quick glance at the snake beside him, and with a swift, practiced motion, they both dis-apparate, vanishing from sight. Meanwhile, Harry stands shivering, his body trembling uncontrollably, as Hermione and Ron, looking disheveled and covered in dirt, make their way towards him with urgency. Hermione, her face etched with anxiety, turns to Ron, who immediately crouches down beside Harry, offering silent support. Harry, his expression filled with worry, watches as Hermione squats down next to him, her concern palpable. In an attempt to calm himself, Harry closes his eyes tightly and takes a deep, steadying breath, his jaw remaining tense as he breathes through his mouth. Elsewhere, Nagini is coiled up in a boat house, where Lucius Malfoy stands in the presence of Voldemort, who is intently examining the skin on his own forearm, lost in thought. When Harry finally opens his eyes, he finds Hermione and Ron staring at him with anxious expressions, their concern mirrored by the chaos unfolding around them as Death Eaters sweep over the school grounds. Amidst the turmoil, a student swoops in on a broomstick, narrowly avoiding a giant who swings a massive scythe, while others engage in fierce battles on the stairs. Hermione, with quick reflexes, dashes through a door, narrowly dodging a bolt of magic, as Harry pounds on another door and manages to shoot a Death Eater with precision. Suddenly, a giant wielding two-pronged weapons spots the trio, prompting them to sprint away, seeking refuge inside a massive bell lying on its side, just as the giant's weapon strikes it with a resounding clang. As colossal spiders begin to scramble over the rubble, the trio is forced to retreat, with Hermione leading the charge as she weaves between the giants, deftly fending off attacks with her wand until they reach a quieter area. They come to an abrupt halt when they spot a Death Eater leaning over a girl's body, while a werewolf glances up menacingly. With quick thinking, Hermione casts a spell that sends Fenrir Greyback hurtling through a window. The trio then races through a closed-end walkway, the giants in relentless pursuit, smashing the walls as they go. As they reach the front of the school, they are confronted by Dementors flying ominously towards them, but are suddenly shielded by a shimmering barrier conjured by Aberforth Dumbledore, who stands with his wand outstretched. As Aberforth and his allies turn back to engage in battle, the trio seizes the opportunity to sprint away, making their way onto a raised walkway and down the steps towards the boat house, where lights flicker and Snape stands with Voldemort. Voldemort fixes his gaze on Snape, who maintains a composed smile, his eyes never leaving Voldemort as he circles him. With a swift, slicing motion of the Elder Wand, Snape is sent crashing against a glass-paneled wall, with Harry watching helplessly from the other side. As Snape's mouth falls open in shock, the snake lunges at him repeatedly, each impact thumping him against the lead-paneled glass, which shudders but holds firm, while Harry and the others can only watch helplessly from outside. Snape's bloodied hand slides down the window, leaving a crimson trail, before he collapses limply to the floor. Harry and the others rush into the boat house, finding Snape still clinging to life. As Snape's lower jaw trembles, Harry moves towards him, kneels down, and leans forward to apply pressure to the wound on Snape's neck in a desperate attempt to staunch the bleeding. The dying Snape turns his head to meet Harry's gaze, their eyes locking in a moment of profound connection, as a single tear rolls down Snape's cheek. Meanwhile, Hermione rummages frantically through her bag, eventually pulling out a small phial, her hands shaking with urgency.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Voldemort glances at the snake before they dis-apparate. Meanwhile, a shivering Harry is approached by a disheveled Hermione and Ron. As Ron crouches beside Harry, Hermione anxiously joins them. Harry closes his eyes, taking a deep breath to steady himself. In a boat house, Nagini is curled up with Lucius Malfoy and Voldemort, who examines his forearm. When Harry opens his eyes, the others watch him anxiously as Death Eaters attack the school. Amidst the chaos, a student flies in on a broomstick, a giant swings a scythe, and battles rage on the stairs. Hermione narrowly avoids a bolt while Harry shoots a Death Eater. A giant spots the trio, forcing them to hide inside a large bell as the giant's weapon strikes it. Colossal spiders emerge, prompting their retreat. Hermione navigates between giants, using her wand to fend off attacks until they reach a quieter area. They stop upon seeing a Death Eater over a girl's body, and Hermione knocks Fenrir Greyback through a window. As they race through a walkway with giants smashing walls, they reach the front of the school, where Dementors approach. Aberforth Dumbledore casts a shimmering barrier, allowing the trio to sprint away towards the boat house where Snape is with Voldemort. Voldemort stares at Snape, who maintains a smile while circling him. With a slicing move from the Elder Wand, Snape falls against a glass wall, and the snake repeatedly lunges at him. Harry and the others watch helplessly as Snape's bloody hand slides down the window. Entering the boat house, they find Snape still alive. Harry kneels to staunch Snape's neck wound as Snape turns to look at him, a tear rolling down his cheek, while Hermione retrieves a small phial from her bag.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Voldemort, the dark wizard feared by many, glances at the snake, his loyal companion Nagini, and they disapparate, vanishing instantly with a crack. Harry continues to shiver as disheveled and dirty from their recent escape through the Forbidden Forest, Hermione and Ron approach him. Hermione, known for her quick thinking in dangerous situations, turns anxiously to Ron, and he crouches down beside Harry. Harry looks worried as Hermione squats down. Harry closes his eyes and takes a deep breath while his jaw remains tense, breathing through his mouth, a technique he learned to calm himself during high-stress situations. Meanwhile, Nagini is curled up in a boat house where Lucius Malfoy, a former influential Death Eater, is present with Voldemort, who examines the skin on his own forearm where the Dark Mark, his symbol, fades. When Harry opens his eyes, the others stare at him anxiously as the Death Eaters, Voldemort's followers, sweep over Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. A student flies in on a broomstick, reminiscent of those used in the wizarding sport Quidditch, as a giant swings a scythe, and the others fight on the stairs. Hermione runs through a door, narrowly avoiding a bolt of magical energy, as Harry beats on a door and shoots a Death Eater, a member of Voldemort's inner circle. A giant with two-pronged weapons, similar to ancient tridents, spots the trio, and they run, hiding inside a huge bell lying on its side as the giant's weapon strikes it, producing a deafening sound. Colossal spiders, descendants of Aragog's brood in the Forbidden Forest, appear scrambling over the rubble, causing them to retreat. Hermione runs between the giants, and they fend off attacks with their wands to reach a quieter area. They stop when they spot a Death Eater leaning over a girl's body, as a werewolf, Fenrir Greyback known for his savagery, glances up. Hermione casts a spell, knocking Fenrir Greyback through a window. They run through a closed-end walkway with the giants keeping pace, smashing the walls. Racing to the front of the school, they see Dementors, soul-sucking creatures that guard Azkaban prison, flying towards them, when suddenly a shimmering barrier is thrown by Aberforth Dumbledore, Albus Dumbledore's brother and owner of the Hog's Head Inn, holding a wand in his outstretched hand. As Aberforth and his allies turn back to fight, the trio sprints away, running onto a raised walkway and down steps towards the boat house lights where Severus Snape, the former Potions Master, is with Voldemort. Voldemort stares at him as Snape perfects a smile, hiding his true loyalties, circling him with his eyes fixed on Voldemort. With a slicing move with the Elder Wand, a legendary wand said to be unbeatable, Snape falls against a glass-paneled wall with Harry on the other side. Mouth agape, the snake lunges repeatedly at Snape, thumping him against the lead-paneled glass, which shakes but doesn't give way, as Harry and the others grab helplessly outside. Snape's bloody hand slides down a window and falls limply to the floor as Harry and the others enter the boat house to find Snape still alive. His lower jaw trembles as Harry moves towards him, kneels down, and leans forward to staunch a wound on Snape's neck, trying to save the man who had protected him for years. The dying Snape turns his head to look at Harry, who gazes deeply into his eyes, seeking understanding, as a tear rolls down Snape's cheek, while Hermione rummages in her bag and pulls out a small phial, hoping to preserve Snape's last memories.

The dying Snape turns his head to look at Harry who gazes deeply into his eyes as a tear rolls down Snape's cheek while Hermione rummages in her bag and pulls out a small phial.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Voldemort glances at the snake and they disapparate. Harry continues to shiver as disheveled and dirty Hermione and Ron approach him. Hermione turns anxiously to Ron and he crouches down beside Harry. Harry looks worried as Hermione squats down. Harry closes his eyes and takes a deep breath while his jaw remains tense breathing through his mouth. Nagini is curled up in a boat house where Lucius Malfoy is present with Voldemort who examines the skin on his own forearm. When Harry opens his eyes the others stare at him anxiously as the Death Eaters sweep over the school. A student flies in on a broomstick as a giant swings a scythe and the others fight on the stairs. Hermione runs through a door narrowly avoiding a bolt as Harry beats on a door and shoots a Death Eater. A giant with twopronged weapons spots the trio and they run hiding inside a huge bell lying on its side as the giant's weapon strikes it. Colossal spiders appear scrambling over the rubble causing them to retreat. Hermione runs between the giants and they fend off attacks with their wands to reach a quieter area. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. They stop when they spot a Death Eater leaning over a girl's body. as a werewolf glances up. Hermione casts a spell knocking Fenrir Greyback through a window. They run through a closedend walkway with the giants keeping pace smashing the walls. Racing to the front of the school they see Dementors flying towards them when suddenly a shimmering barrier is thrown by Aberforth. Dumbledore holding a wand in his outstretched hand. As Aberforth and his allies turn back to fight the trio sprints away running onto a raised walkway and down steps towards the boat house lights where Snape is with Voldemort. Voldemort stares at him as Snape perfects a smile circling him with his eyes fixed on Voldemort. With a slicing move with the Elder Wand Snape falls against a glass paneled wall with Harry on the other side. Mouth agape the snake lunges repeatedly at Snape thumping him against the lead panned glass which shakes but does not give way as Harry and the others grab helplessly outside. Snape's bloody hand slides down a window and falls limply to the floor as Harry and the others enter the boat house to find Snape still alive. His lower jaw trembles as Harry moves towards him kneels down and leans forward to staunch a wound on Snape's neck. The dying Snape turns his head to look at Harry who gazes deeply into his eyes as a tear rolls down Snape's cheek while Hermione rummages in her bag and pulls out a small phial.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Balthazar peers at the raven, and they teleport. Jasper continues to wobble as messy and grimy, Penelope and Edgar drift towards him. Penelope spins worriedly to Edgar, and he hunches down beside Jasper. Jasper appears anxious as Penelope crouches down. Jasper shuts his eyes and exhales deeply while his lips remain tight, inhaling through his nose. Igor is coiled up in a lighthouse where Draco Blackwood is present with Balthazar, who inspects the tattoo on his own ankle. When Jasper opens his eyes, the others gaze at him nervously as the Shadow Walkers surge over the fortress. A scholar glides in on a kite as a colossus wields a trident, and the others battle on the ladders. Penelope dashes through a gateway, narrowly evading an arrow, as Jasper pounds on a hatch and strikes a Shadow Walker. A behemoth with three-pronged sticks spots the group, and they flee, hiding inside a massive drum lying on its rim as the behemoth's tool bashes it. Gigantic beetles appear crawling over the debris, prompting them to withdraw. Penelope dashes between the behemoths, and they defend against onslaughts with their staffs to reach a calmer spot. They pause when they notice a Shadow Walker stooping over a boy's figure, as a gorgon peeks up. Penelope conjures a charm, flinging Randall Greyfang through a portal. They scamper through a dead-end corridor with the behemoths trailing closely, smashing the ceilings. Dashing to the entrance of the fortress, they notice Phantoms soaring toward them, when suddenly a glittering barricade is hurled by Alistair Everwood, holding a staff in his extended grip. As Alistair and his comrades pivot back to combat, the group dashes away, sprinting onto a suspended bridge and down ramps towards the lighthouse glimmers where Orion is with Balthazar. Balthazar glares at him as Orion perfects a grin, orbiting him with his gaze fixed on Balthazar. With a slashing gesture with the Ancient Staff, Orion collapses against a crystal-paneled barrier with Jasper on the opposite side. Jaw slack, the raven dives repeatedly at Orion, pounding him against the leaded crystal, which trembles but doesn't shatter, as Jasper and the others clutch helplessly outdoors. Orion's crimson hand slips down a screen and drops weakly to the ground as Jasper and the others enter the lighthouse to find Orion still conscious. His lower lip quivers as Jasper moves towards him, bends down, and leans forward to tend to a scratch on Orion's shoulder. The fading Orion tilts his head to gaze at Jasper, who peers intently into his eyes as a droplet slides down Orion's face, while Penelope digs in her pouch and extracts a tiny bottle.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Voldemort disapparates with Nagini, leaving Harry shivering as Hermione and Ron approach. Meanwhile, Lucius Malfoy and Voldemort are in a boathouse. As Death Eaters attack the school, Harry, Hermione, and Ron fend off threats. A giant's weapon forces them to hide under a bell, and colossal spiders chase them away. They find a Death Eater with a girl and Hermione knocks Fenrir Greyback through a window. As they run through a walkway, Aberforth Dumbledore casts a barrier against Dementors. The trio heads to the boathouse, witnessing Snape's encounter with Voldemort. After Voldemort's attack with the Elder Wand, Snape lies gravely injured. Harry attempts to help as Snape looks at him, a tear rolling down his cheek, while Hermione retrieves a phial from her bag.
